intro: Psychotria bifaria var. minimicalyx, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and dense vegetation. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
